website_summaries.verdict: One bottle will treat up to 18 gallons of gas, and you get 6 for an unbeatable price. The best deal for improving your fuel system on a budget.
pros: In impressive deal on a product that works for most vehicles at reducing pinging and knocking
Ideal for boosting mpg for users who prefer to fuel up with low-octane gas
cons: Boosting benefits are a bit less noticeable compared to pricier brands, but it's a reasonable choice if you can't afford more

customer_reviews.title: Runs solidly in my tuned Coyote 5.0...
customer_reviews.text: I ran this stuff in my '86 Mustang 5.0 back in the day with spectacular results... made her run so solidly against Camaro IROC Z's. Fast forward to today... I've been running this 104+ in my 2014 Mustang 5.0 Coyote, again with great results. I have a 93 octane performance tune on my 5.0, and running 104+ with 93 octane pump gas helps me get the most solid performance. She just wants to scream and go... Its not as expensive as other octane boost products, and yet has a long history of great performance and cleaning results.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: I use two at a time
customer_reviews.text: I have an old F150 with a 22 Gal gas tank. It always ran sluggish and struggled up hills. I added two of these bottles with 94 octane to my gas tank (I always used the lowest grade gas to save money). Now my truck has renewed HP and sails up the hills it used to be sluggish on. Octane Boost works. I need two bottles every time I fill up but it has made a 300,000+ mile old engine seem like (almost) new again. The engine runs smoother and quieter now too. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great way to boost octane rating
customer_reviews.text: My husband swears by this product for use in his Corvette. The car has been modified and requires a high octane gasoline. By using this, in addition to the higher octane rated gas at the pump, he achieves the right mix for his engine. It runs smoothly and responds well.
customer_reviews.author: The Negotiator

customer_reviews.title: This product is very good.
customer_reviews.text: This product really works. I have been using it for years now. BUT, I don't use it for the extra octane boost. I use it because really keeps the engine clean in the inside. Once I open an engine that I have been using with this product and amazingly it was incredibly clean inside. Pistons, valves, every was with no carbon at all.
customer_reviews.author: Abakar

customer_reviews.title: I turn Regular gas in to High Octane
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my 2013 Infiniti EX37 which requires 91 plus octane. I was tried of the price of Super and was using mid grade. The mileage was the same but the performance sucked. I now use this product with Regular gas. I save, at least 25cents a gallon. Mileage is the same the difference is the performance. This car feels like it gained 25 horsepower and thats no jive. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Moondog Vinyl

customer_reviews.title: Maybe helps
customer_reviews.text: Honestly not sure if it does anything. My 2004 SL600 is supposed to run on 93 minimum and 91 is highest available in my area. I dump one in with each tank to ease my mind. No pinging but maybe same without. From what I have read it raises octane less that 1 so not sure if significant or not. Considerably less expensive than others.
customer_reviews.author: RichardB.

customer_reviews.title: Might work on some vehicles.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is not flammable so thats is why it cleans and helps with gas mileage. It will bump your 91 to 91.2 mabe or 91.3. However many points it says is in .10s which equals 1. So 10 bottles will make 1 point higher. From 91 to 92. But 93 is a little more and is worth the couple of cents.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Walker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: use every day in my 2 cycle motor, makes all the difference in its running
customer_reviews.author: steven a.siegel

customer_reviews.title: "Miracle Worker"
customer_reviews.text: I've been using 104+ in my '73 MG-B for over a year (recommended by my MG specialist). It's a "Miracle Worker". More power, cuts down on the fuel (more miles-per-gallon). After using it the FIRST time, I noticed all sluggishness was gone from the engine. I'd used various products down through the years, none of them benefitting the engine. I'm so thankful my mechanic (Sports Car Warehouse in Arlington, Texas) suggested this product. I realize this may sound a bit extreme, but it's a factual statement. Now, I supply my kids with 104+ for their older vehicles, ordering from Amazon by the six-packs!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Mack

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: this product works but your computer is set from the factory for a certain octane fuel .anything after that is not recognized kinda a waste if you have a pre 96 vehicle maybe or a tune
customer_reviews.author: john p.

customer_reviews.title: Better then paying Premium Fuel
customer_reviews.text: 104 Octane Booster help your normal 89 Octane to 91 Octane fuel. I don't really see much of a different on better MPG but as least i don't get the knocking noise from low octane fuel anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Yuchin Chen

customer_reviews.title: Make the engine ping go away
customer_reviews.text: Just what I need for my race car. Cheaper on amazon
customer_reviews.author: Jdandhogs

customer_reviews.title: Confident in the product's performance.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product in the past as an additive to the fuel used my 1962 Corvette.
customer_reviews.author: Stoney

customer_reviews.title: 104. Boost
customer_reviews.text: Add 3 or 4 oz to 5 gal of premium to help cure engine knock.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: No noticeable change in performance when using. In car or motorcycle. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Vince D.

customer_reviews.title: 1967 Gto. Followed instruction on bottle. No noticeable ...
customer_reviews.text: 1967 Gto. Followed instruction on bottle. No noticeable reduction in engine ping. Added another bottle. Again, no improvement. Back to 100 octane aviation gas
customer_reviews.author: Peter Walton

customer_reviews.title: ADD IT BEFORE FILL UP
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product great when u added to the gas before you fill up
customer_reviews.author: Spanky Newman

customer_reviews.title: Breathes new life into an old snowblower that is losing power!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 28 year old snowblower that is losing power so I added this stuff and the snowblower works much better. I look forward to getting at least a few more seasons from the old gal.
customer_reviews.author: MJWmisty

customer_reviews.title: It improves, gas mileage, cleans injectors, and over all performance is great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 2019 Dodge charger scatpack 392 6.4lt HEMI V8.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace T.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not good either.
customer_reviews.text: Eh. I wouldn't waste the money again, not bad by any means though.
customer_reviews.author: DustinD12

customer_reviews.title: My car became a race car!
customer_reviews.text: Well maybe not, but it definitely helped my sluggish engine.
customer_reviews.author: NonstopInk

customer_reviews.title: A Necessity for High Performance motors
customer_reviews.text: This product allows all the old Muscle cars and Hot Rods to be driven as they should be driven, without de-tuning or the pre-ignition caused by the poor gasoline available today.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S. Genthner

customer_reviews.title: Very decent additive, but don't let the number "104" fool you
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't magically give you the equivalent of 104 octane. In fact, it's hard to find *any* real numbers telling you just how much this product is going to increase the octane rating of your average tankfull of gas. But I still trust it to do no harm to engine components, and to increase the apparent octane enough to reduce engine knocking. At this price, it is debateable whether it's better to buy higher octane gas or use additives, but I keep a bottle or two in my vehicle for the rare situation when I can't find high-test....
customer_reviews.author: Teh Arbitrageur

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This product has been around for many years and always works! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When gas prices went up why did the price differential ...
customer_reviews.text: When gas prices went up why did the price differential from 87 octane (regular) to 93 octane (top grade) increase from ~$0.25 to almost $1!!!!!!!! For decades the differential was ~$0.25? So now for $5 per 104 octane boost container, each 18 gallon fill up I will save me ~$13. All of the claims of fuel system cleansing and higher gas mileage are total nonsense but if you have any newer car that senses knocking you should also experience a power increase (2%-5%) under heavy load/maximum acceleration.
customer_reviews.author: US home buyer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good works
customer_reviews.text: I'm a mechanic and I've use this product and it does add a bit of pop to the fuel. I think that it was the least expensive I could find. I had to pull a big boat. And it did take away the engine knock from low octane. I don't know if there is a cheaper product that would do the same if there was I would use it
customer_reviews.author: Cliff S

customer_reviews.title: Great octane booster but pricey
customer_reviews.text: This is very effective at raising the octane rating. To use it constantly is pricey though but it does make the car run better. Maybe shell should buy Stabil and put this into vpower versus bubbles that sound good but do nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Sigara

customer_reviews.title: save your money if you have a stock car. but if you dont! WELCOME! my car loves this bottle!
customer_reviews.text: amazing little addition if you have a car that has turbo and heavily modified! 2007 mini cooper S, stage 3 tune, catless exhaust and downpipe, true cold air intake and 50x60 turbo. pushing 270whp if you have a stock car then save your money because it will do you no difference.
customer_reviews.author: andres lillo

customer_reviews.title: Increase Gas Mileage
customer_reviews.text: Use this every other tank for a 4 MPG increase in a 2015 Sonata Limited.
customer_reviews.author: bmac32

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I've used this stuff for decades on my 70s and 80s BMWs.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product
customer_reviews.text: I started using this product a few months ago in my 60 year old car, and it is running better. It is probably counter-acting some of the unbelievable additives that are in GASOLINE nowadays, which do NOT agree with the older vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Finlay

customer_reviews.title: Used it since 1980!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. Use it all the time in a 1986 ford f250 300. Never pings anymore. pulls the plow like a dream when you add this product to the high test gas. It really helps too when im in the woods and need that extra power and i'm pulling trees and timbering. The product just really does work!! Very happy with the increased power and torque from the engine and no knocking and pinging!
customer_reviews.author: tml9170

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME perchase ! We were out driving, decided we need more octane boost, ordered it from Amazon Prime while on the road, and then the bottles showed up a day and a half later !
customer_reviews.author: WakeboardChick

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble with my boat engine dieseling upon shutdown after hard use. Premium gas solves this problem. This product does not. It does seem to help a little.
customer_reviews.author: MBrett

customer_reviews.title: but I love my mustang
customer_reviews.text: it stopped the knocking , but my car cant go back to the non leaded gasoline anymore. greedy bastard! but I love my mustang.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar. the Cersar

customer_reviews.title: a must have for any hot rod. Worth the ...
customer_reviews.text: a must have for any hot rod. Worth the few bucks per fill up to lower risk of engine backfire on supercharged and turbo engines !
customer_reviews.author: MARIO V

customer_reviews.title: do not use if ur car is set to like 91.
customer_reviews.text: be careful with the ratio, my car was set to 93 octaine, do not use if ur car is set to like 91...etc
customer_reviews.author: Jed

customer_reviews.title: Octane Boost
customer_reviews.text: I choose rating because the Boost was simply that: A BOOST. I liked that it did exactly what its name implied. I have recommended it to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: RONALD C. SOMMERSELL

customer_reviews.title: Works for me...
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot on the internet about the good and the bad of octane boosters. All I can say is that it worked for me. I have a Honda 750 with very small low speed carburetor jets. 104 definitely gives each tank of gas the extra kick I need for the lower end of the gears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Each motorcycle's owner's manual advises using good gasoline and a high octane rating
customer_reviews.text: I have two motorcycles. Over time I found out that the gasoline I put into my fuel tanks makes a big difference. Each motorcycle's owner's manual advises using good gasoline and a high octane rating. I tried several octane boosters and I like this product. I put Shell 93 and about one once of 104 for each gallon of gasoline. Both motorcycles run very good with this combination.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund F. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great for older cars that have always needed 91 Octane
customer_reviews.text: My 2000 Mercedes E55 required 91 Octane from the first day. At 200,000 miles 91 octane pings a bit (likely higher compression from carbon buildup). I just put one of these in each time I fill up and the car runs flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: All Outta Bubble Gum

customer_reviews.title: Moving
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the Vette hummmming. My car just loves it & so do I more punch to the old girl. Greeeat
customer_reviews.author: joeger

customer_reviews.title: octane boost
customer_reviews.text: seems to have met expectations, car runs fine for first fill up with octane booster added. I will need to see on second tank.
customer_reviews.author: john suarez

customer_reviews.title: tune up in a bottle
customer_reviews.text: It woke up a few horses in my 1990 convertible mustang.excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: George Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Improved gas mileage, cleans injectors, eliminates pinging, ...
customer_reviews.text: Improved gas mileage, cleans injectors, eliminates pinging, and you can use it with the cheapest, lowest octane fuel and it will still raise the octane level to 104!
customer_reviews.author: Bay Area Conservative

customer_reviews.title: Unsure results
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good product for what it is an octane booster. They thing I do not like is there is no on the website to calculate how much it boost it. I tried it in my 383 C4 Vette. Thought It sound like needed more octane. I'll know better in awhile, the car is HEAVILY modified, I bought it without a lot of documentation, we are now putting in light weight clutch, flywheel, trying to figure bore and stroke and cam duration. Then we need work on the ECM and will get it dyno tuned. After that I'll be able to tell. It did seem to make a difference, just by the fell of it.
customer_reviews.author: Little Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Bought premium gas from one of those cheap stations. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought premium gas from one of those cheap stations. My car was out of breath in no time. 104 brought it back to life.
customer_reviews.author: GT500

customer_reviews.title: Saturn Aura XE 2008 loves this addititive
customer_reviews.text: Yes, my car in NJ and used to octane 91 or 93 definitely accelerates a little better from ...say 60 - 80 mph... I love this product. You can feel the smoothness in the acceleration at highway speeds and during overtaking.
customer_reviews.author: Anupam Biswas

customer_reviews.title: needs 104 octane for certain Rolls Royce cars
customer_reviews.text: required for 1971 Rolls Royce Silver Shadow-required for 100 octane Rolls- increased performance and fuel MPG for a 40+ older classic car
